name: Paraguay
takeaway: During 2023, the possibility of establishing diplomatic relations in the PRC was part of the presidential campaign, with one candidate clearly advocating the idea. While at the same time, all candidates expressed interest in keeping relations with Taiwan, many in the elite of the country are begining to question the disadvantages of the status quo.

The level of exposure of Paraguay to PRC influence is low, even though there are some voices in the media in particular that are begining to replicate the PRC narrative of economic success and human rights advances.
The Technology Domain is where the PRC has greatest presence in Paraguay. Society in general has a positive image of the PRC.
description-1: In 2023, Paraguay had a GDP per capita of US$6,260 and a total population of 6.80 million people.
description-2: Paraguay established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in . Paraguay was ranked 115th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 63/100.

Media.evidence: No Paraguayan media organization appears as member of the World Chinese Media.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: No Paraguayan media organization or journalist appear as member of BRNA.

Media.evidence: The journalist and former candidate for vice president (2018) Leo Rubin participated in the press section of the Silk Road Forum in Beijing in 2023 with his Made in Paraguay program on the Ñanduti media.

Media.evidence: Except for what you can find online in Youtube or CGTN en Español, I could not find a cable distributor or any other evidence of PRC state media being broadcasted in Bolivia.

Media.evidence: The only personality found was Jorge Peralta, vicepresident of the Chamber of Commerce China-Paraguay but he refers to the PRC as making giant steps in favor of human rights by taking 800 million people out poverty and does not refers to re-education camps or Uyghurs or nothing like that.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Paraguay does no have formal diplomatic relations with the PRC and does not have a parliamentary friendship group. There is a friendship group with Taiwan.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During the pandemic in 2020 Paraguay recevied 700kg of medical materials from the PRC consulate in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

Economy.evidence: A couple of years ago China became the main provider of imports to Paraguay but still the main trading partner is Brazil. Exports to China are probably carried out through commercial triangulation with neighboring countries, but there is no official data to corroborate its commercial impact.

Technology.evidence: Apparently only COPACO (the state telephone company) has agreements with Huawei. One due to a debt acquired from another operator with Huawei (still not paid) and another one a donation of equipments made by Huawei. No 5G networks or agreements are still in place in Paraguay.

Technology.evidence: COPACO is using Huawei hardware for its fiber optic networks.
